snippet.title: xjump (FALLING TOWER), jumping game for X
snippet.description:
xjump [1] brought me back some old memory, but you have to read my blog post [2], because it's not a short story.

It's simple to play, just not easy to jump right. [wasd/hjkl/arrow] to move, [space] is also for jump, [P] to pause, [Shift+Q] to quit.

It comes with three themes, using `-theme` or `-themeFile`:

(0:00) Default
(0:13) Ion
(0:33) Jump 'n Bump

The default window size is 546x588.

I wonder if anyone has managed to implement this game in terminal, which would be called cjump or tjump? It shouldn't be too hard, right?

I found this continued version on GitHub, with newer version numbers, the last release v2.7.5 by the original authors was 13 years ago. So, I think I would record this newest version even I got no clue what has been done.

$$$#

In 2017, it will be jumping for two decades, it's more energized than that bunny battery even it's one decade short. Jumping is harder than drumming.

$$$#

* Since 1997
* Version 2.9.3 (2015-05-10, post v2.9.1 (2015-05-01), post v2.7.5 (2002-01-25))
* In C99 with X11
* By Tatsuya Kudoh and Masato Taruishi
* GPLv2

[1]: https://github.com/hugomg/xjump
[2]: https://yjlv.blogspot.com/2015/11/xjump-falling-tower.html#more
